review_title: Such a supportive and happy workplace
pros: Flexible working, supportive staff and great team. Such a rewarding and meaningful job.
cons: Location is north London so can be tricky/ time consuming to get to if you don’t live in London.

review_title: Very kind and supportive working culture
pros: - Very supportive CEO, Cheryl Tissot - Kind and trusting working environment - Growing team - Charity is rebuilding from pandemic - Lots of opportunities to get involved in helping with events - Very good work/life balance, hybrid working with 2 days per week in the office, work mobile phone - Smiles of children when we grant their wishes!!!!!!
cons: - Non-central office (Zone 4 North London), but reachable by public transport or car

job_title: Events and Services Administrator in London, England
pros: Such a positive, nurturing environment and full of wonderful caring people.
cons: Office is not in central London so can be a difficult commute depending on where you are travelling from.

pros: The entire team is completely new, even the management and they are the friendliest team I've ever worked with. Everyone works together and supports each other for a cause we all believe in. A creative and buzzy office where every idea is heard.
cons: The office can be tricky to get to

job_title: Senior Fundraising Manager in Finchley, England
pros: Well funded, clean office and cleaners
cons:
Lack of robust analysis 
No process
Poor financial reporting

pros: Great cause makes a huge difference to the families
cons:
Staff treated terribly resulting in very high staff turnover
Totally run by founders/trustees - All decisions made externally 
SMT have no control over their own teams
No perks 
No respect for staff
Bullying culture

pros: amazing work to help unwell children
cons: Founder lead org, trustees call all the shots, non progressive, staff have little empowerment, culture is terrible, staff turnover very high
